You hurl a wad of aetheric mud, paint, or other goopy substance at your foe, coating them in a thick and heavy coat. The target takes 2d8 earth damage plus 1d6 persistent mental damage depending on its Reflex save due to the lingering damage to their self-worth. A creature taking persistent damage from this spell takes a â€“10-foot status bonus to its Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.spell-effects.Item.PKzQ7NNAxR03lQiM]{Spell Effect: Peat Pelt}

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and no persistent damage, and you knock them back 5 feet.

Failure The creature takes full damage and persistent damage, and they fall prone.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and normal persistent damage, they fall prone, and a 5-foot-radius around them is considered difficult terrain for as long as they are taking persistent damage.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 2d8, and the persistent damage increases by 1d6.
